intro: Eubotrys racemosa, commonly known as the clustered bellflower, is a flowering plant native to the eastern United States. It belongs to the Campanulaceae family and is characterized by its clusters of bell-shaped, white or pale blue flowers. The plant typically grows in moist, wooded areas and has opposite, lance-shaped leaves. Its flowers bloom in the summer, attracting various pollinators such as bees and butterflies. Eubotrys racemosa is often found in shaded environments and can thrive in a variety of soil types.
